member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob
member.summary: Base class for binary large objects.
member.remarks:
Blobs let you store uninterpreted binary data.
You can access a blob only within an active transaction on an .
Blobs are simple byte buffers that are accessed as a whole.
Instances of this class are always second class objects (not persisted by themselves, only through another persistent object).

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.STANDARD
member.summary: Indicates, that standard behavior is requested: blob is loaded completely into memory.
member.remarks: The standard behavior is available with all backends.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.INCREMENTAL
member.summary: Indicates, that non-standard behavior is requested: blob is loaded chunkwise into memory. Only available with the FastObjects backend.
member.remarks: The incremental loading behavior is only available with the FastObjects backend.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the position within the current Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the origin parameter.
A value of type SeekOrigin indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current Blob.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Changes the size of a Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks:
Using this method to enlarge a Blob in advance is more efficient than writing and letting Telerik.OpenAccess .NET enlarge the object in small increments.
An active transaction is required.
member.param: The new length of the Blob in bytes.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Close
member.summary: Flushes the content of the Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks:
In general, Close has not to be called explicitly.
An active transaction is required.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Flush
member.summary: Clears all buffers for this Blob and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks:
In general, Flush has not to be called explicitly.
An active transaction is required.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the Blob and advances the position within the Blob by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the Blob. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.
member.returns: The value at the current position of -1 if the end has been reached.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a sequence of bytes from the specified position. The current position within the Blob is not modified. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.
member.param: The byte array to contain the data read. The length of the array determines the number of bytes to be read.
The position in the Blob to begin reading from (zero based).
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or zero (0) if the end of the Blob has been reached.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is null.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a number of bytes from to the specified position and advances the position within the Blob by the number of bytes read. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.
member.param: An array of bytes. Contains the byte values of the Blob between offset and (offset + count - 1) when this method returns.
The zero-based byte offset in buffer at which to begin storing the data read from the current Blob.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current Blob position.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not available, or zero (0) if the end of the Blob has been reached.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is too small.
Illegal value of or .

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the Blob and advances the position within the Blob by one byte. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.
member.param: The byte value to write to the current position.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current Blob position and advances the current position by the number of bytes written. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from buffer to the current Blob.

The zero-based byte offset in
from which to begin copying bytes to the current Blob.
The number of bytes to be written to the current Blob.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is too small.
Illegal value of or .

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a sequence of bytes to the current Blob at the specified position. The current position within this Blob is not changed. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.
member.param: The position in the Blob to begin writing (zero based).
The byte array containing the data to be written. The length of the array determines the number of bytes written.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
is null.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string that represents the current Blob.
member.remarks: The value returned might be useful for debugging purposes.
member.returns: A string that represents the current Blob.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Determines whether two Blob instances have the same content and are equal. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.remarks: The object must be of type AbstractBlob and have the same content to let this method return true.
member.returns: true if the other Blob has the same content; otherwise, false.
member.param: The other blob to compare with.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.GetHashCode
member.summary: Serves as a hash function for Blobs, suitable for use in hashing algorithms and data structures like a hash table. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.returns: A hash code for this object.
member.remarks: Currently, the hash code returned is the length of the blob.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.GetImplementation
member.summary: hidden

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Duplicate(Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.BlobAdapter,System.Boolean)
member.summary: hidden

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Copy(Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob)
member.summary: hidden

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.CanRead
member.summary: Indicates whether the Blob content can be read. This is possible if there is an active transaction.
member.value: true if reading is supported; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.CanWrite
member.summary: Indicates whether the Blob content can be modified. This is possible if there is an active transaction.
member.value: true if writing is supported; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.CanSeek
member.summary: Indicates whether the Blob supports seeking. This is possible if there is an active transaction.
member.value: Returns true if seeking is supported; otherwise, false.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Length
member.summary: Gets the size of the Blob in bytes. There must be an active transaction, when this method is called.
member.value: The size of the Blob in bytes.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.AbstractBlob.Position
member.summary: Controls the actual position within the current Blob. There must be an active transaction when this property is used.
member.exception: Blob was closed before.
member.value: The byte position. (zero-based)
member.remarks: An active transaction is required.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.CacheReferenceType
member.summary: Specifies the type of the references maintained by the cache of the OpenAccessContext

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.CacheReferenceType.Auto
member.summary: Specifies that references to fetched data are strongly held and references to user instances are weakly held

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.CacheReferenceType.Weak
member.summary: Specifies that a reference is maintained using a System.WeakReference allowing the garbage collector to reclaim the object

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.CacheReferenceType.Strong
member.summary: Specifies that all references can't be reclaimed

member.summary: Facade that contains nested classes describing each exposed Performance Counter for Telerik Data Access

member.summary: Full name of the Telerik Data Access product

member.summary: Default description for performance counter categories in Telerik Data Access.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.PerformanceCounterDefinitions.L2CacheSync
member.summary: Provides information about Level 2 Cache Synchronization metrics Performance Counter
member.remarks: This class provides descriptions for Telerik Data Access Level 2 Cache Synchronization performance metrics like: - number of sent eviction requests - number of received eviction requests - number of remote status requests. This counter is useful in scenarios where distributed Level 2 Cache is enabled and helps you keep track of communication messages between participating clusters.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.PerformanceCounterDefinitions.L2Cache
member.summary: Provides information about Level 2 metrics Performance Counter
member.remarks: This class provides descriptions for Telerik Data Access Level 2 Cache performance metrics like: - number of cache hits for single objects - number of cache misses for single objects - number of objects in the cache - number of cache hits for queries - number of cache misses for queries - number of queries in the cache This counter is useful in scenarios where you want to track Level 2 Cache utilization.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.PerformanceCounterDefinitions.L2Cache.ObjectMisses
member.summary: Gets the definition of Object Misses performance counter. Counter measures the number of times L2 Cache fails to provide an object (cache miss).

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.PerformanceCounterDefinitions.L2Cache.ObjectHits
member.summary: Gets the definition of Object Hits performance counter. Counter measures the number of times L2 Cache succeeds to provide an object (cache hit).

member.summary: Gets the definition of Object Entries performance counter. Counter measures the number of objects stored in L2 Cache.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.PerformanceCounterDefinitions.L2Cache.QueryMisses
member.summary: Gets the definition of Query Misses performance counter. Counter measures the number of times L2 Cache fails to provide a query (cache miss).

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.PerformanceCounterDefinitions.L2Cache.QueryHits
member.summary: Gets the definition of Query Hits performance counter. Counter measures the number of times L2 Cache succeeds to provide a query (cache hit).

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.PerformanceCounterDefinitions.L2Cache.QueryEntries
member.summary: Gets the definition of Query Entries performance counter. Counter measures the number of queries stored in L2 Cache.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream
member.summary: Exposes a stream around a database binary field.

remarks.para: The stream allows for memory optimized access to large amounts of data. It reads and writes the data in chunks and allows for seeking.
The instance that holds the stream must be persisted on the database before the stream methods can be used. This is to ensure that the insert and update methods have a row to operate on.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.#ctor(Telerik.OpenAccess.IOpenAccessBinaryStream,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BinaryStream class for the specified info and field name.
member.param: Database internal information.
The field name.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the BinaryStream type.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.Flush
member.summary: Clears buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the database.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: Sets the current position of this stream to the given value.
member.param: The point relative to origin from which to begin seeking.
Specifies the beginning, the end, or the current position as a reference point for origin, using a value of type SeekOrigin.
member.returns: The new position in the stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: Sets the length of this stream to the given value.
member.param: The new length of the stream.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads a block of bytes from the stream and writes the data in a given buffer.
member.param: When this method returns, contains the specified byte array with the values between offset and (offset + count - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The byte offset in array at which the read bytes will be placed.
The maximum number of bytes to read.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This might be less than the number of bytes requested if that number of bytes are not currently available, or zero if the end of the stream is reached.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a block of bytes to the stream.
member.param: The buffer containing data to write to the stream.
The zero-based byte offset in array from which to begin copying bytes to the stream.
The maximum number of bytes to write.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BinaryStream.SetDataAccess(Telerik.OpenAccess.DataAccessKind)
member.summary: Set the stream's behavior - readonly, writeonly, readwrite
member.param: The kind.

member.summary: Defines the calculation operation for discriminator values

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.DiscriminatorValueEquation.Default
member.summary: Defines that the default calculation operation is used.
member.remarks: The default is the hash value of the classes full name string.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.DiscriminatorValueEquation.Hash
member.summary: Defines that the hash value of the full name of the class is used.
member.remarks: This is the optimal solution from runtime and space requierements. The discriminator column will be integer column.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.DiscriminatorValueEquation.Name
member.summary: Defines that the simple name of the class is used ad discriminator value.
member.remarks: Because the name is a string, the discriminator column will be a variable length string column. Using a string makes it easier to analyse the database content without knowledge about the value. The same class name should not be reused in the class hierarchy.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.DiscriminatorValueEquation.Fullname
member.summary: Defines that the full name of the class is used ad discriminator value.
member.remarks: Because the full name is a string, the discriminator column will be a variable length string column. Using a string makes it easier to analyse the database content without knowledge about the value.

member.returns: Enumeration representing the state of the persistent object.
member.exception: Entity is not marked as persistent.
No entity passed in.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.PersistenceStateHelper.GetState(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the state of the named property or field from the persistent entity.
member.param: The entity holding the field or property with the respective name.
The name of the field or property the state should be returned for.
member.returns: Enumeration representing the state of the data held by the named field or property.
member.exception: Entity is not marked as persistent.
No entity or field name passed in.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.PersistenceStateHelper.GetOriginalValue``1(System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Returns the original value of the named property of field from the persistent entity.

remarks.para: If a property or field in a persistent type is changed or marked as dirty, the original value might be of interest. This method can be used to access the original value if it is available.

Per default only the original values for types marked with concurrency mode are kept. If all original values are of interest, the context.ContextProperties.MaintainOriginalValues property has to be set to true.

To keep all original values in memory involves a memory overhead. If one field is made dirty, all fields of that respective type are stored in an extra data structure. Also, additional operations can be needed to maintain this data structure.
If the object is new, the default value of the respective property type is returned. If the property or field is clean, the clean value is returned.

member.typeparam: The type of the expected return value. Object can be used for untyped access.
member.param: The object holding the field or property of interest.
The name of the property or field of interest.
member.returns: The old value if it was available and the property or field was dirty, the actual value otherwise.
member.exception: If one of the arguments is null or string.Empty
If the entity is not managed by this context.
If the no property or field with the specified name can be found.
If the original value is not available.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.PersistenceStateHelper.IsDetached(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks if a given entity is tracked by Telerik Data Access.
member.param: The entity to be checked.
member.returns: True if the object is tracked.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.QueryOptions
member.summary: Represents the query execution options in a Telerik Data Access query.
member.remarks: Options can affect various aspects of the query execution in Telerik Data Access. Side effects include the inability to store query results in the L2 cache.

member.summary: Creates a new instance with default values.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.QueryOptions.ToString
member.summary: Returns a string representation of the QueryOptions instance. Skips options that have no set value.
member.returns: String with all set key:value pairs

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.QueryOptions.NonLocking

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Cluster.OpenAccessClusterTransport
member.summary: Interface to implement custom cluster transport.
member.remarks: Use this interface to implement cluster transport for Telerik Data Access. The transport receives messages when objects or types are evicted from the database wide cache used by a Telerik Data Access instance. It must communicate these messages to other nodes in the cluster. The instance passed to the function should be used to process messages received from other nodes in the cluster.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OAConnection
member.summary: Represents a connection to the database.

remarks.para: An OAConnection provides an ADO.NET provider independent way of working with the database. An OAConnection can be obtained via a call to the property. This connection can be used to execute SQL statements (queries,commands etc) using the standard ADO.NET method calls.

The connection obtained via this property is owned by the context i.e. opening and closing of the actual database connection is handled by the context. The ownership of the connection is given up by the context only if the context is disposed before the connection. The property begins a database transaction before returning the connection. Any statements executed via this connection are automatically executed within this transaction. In order to commit or rollback the changes performed by the executed statements, the user needs to call the or method respectively. This means that these changes are always committed or rolled back together with the context changes. Since the transaction boundaries are controlled via the context it is not allowed to call and /.

In order to ensure that the database connection encapsulated by this OAConnection instance is not left open, it is very important to call the method (either explicitly or via a using block) on this instance. Calling Dispose notifies the owning context that no user code uses the connection anymore and that it can be safely closed. In case the owning context is disposed before the connection it is the user's responsiblity to ensure that the underlying database connection is closed.

example.para: The following example obtains an OAConnection from the context and executes a stored procedure that returns some rows. The result of the procedure is then materialized to instances of a type using the method. The 'CustOrderHistory' is a class with two properties that is used to hold the rows returned by the procedure.

para.note: In order to execute this sample you would need to ensure that the '[dbo].[CustOrderHist]' stored procedure in the Sql Server 'Northwind' sample database exists.

example.code:
Dim context As New EntitiesModel()
Using connection As OAConnection = context.Connection Using command As OACommand = connection.CreateCommand() command.CommandText = "CustOrderHist" command.CommandType = System.Data.CommandType.StoredProcedure
Dim customerID As New OAParameter("@CustomerID", "ALFKI") command.Parameters.Add(customerID)
Using reader As OADataReader = command.ExecuteReader() Dim materialized = context.Translate(Of CustOrderHistory)(reader)
For Each item In materialized Console.WriteLine("Product - {0}, Quantity - {1} ", item.ProductName, item.Total) Next End Using End Using End Using
'The 'CustOrderHistory' class Public Class CustOrderHistory
Public Property ProductName() As String
Public Property Total() As Integer
End Class

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OAConnection.BeginDbTransaction(System.Data.IsolationLevel)
member.summary: Not supported
member.remarks: Calling this method on a connection obtained from the context results in an since the context is solely responsible for transaction management. A context owned connection always has a transaction started on it.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OAConnection.Close
member.summary: Closes the connection to the database only in case the owning context is disposed, else an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: The recommended way to close a connection is to call the method after having used the connection. The owning context will use the connection to save/rollback it's changes (after a call to /) and then close the connection. Calling this method on a connection obtained from the context results in an if the context is not yet disposed,since the context is solely responsible for opening and closing the database connection.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OATransaction
member.summary: Specifies the transaction for an OACommand.
member.remarks:
The transaction management for an OAConcection that is obtained from the is done exlusively by the context.When a connection is given out by the context a database transaction is already started on it. Any statements that the user executes via this connection are automatically enlisted in this transaction. In order to commit or rollback the transaction you need to call the or method respectively.
It is not allowed to call the or methods on an OATransaction if the transaction is started on a context owned OAConnection.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OATransaction.Commit
member.summary: Commits the underlying transaction. Not supported for a transaction started on a context owned connection.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OATransaction.Rollback
member.summary: Rolls back the underlying transaction. Not supported for a transaction started on a context owned connection.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OATransaction.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases the unmanaged resources used by the DbTransaction and optionally releases the managed resources.
member.param: If true, this method releases all resources held by any managed objects that this DbTransaction references.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OATransaction.DbConnection
member.summary: Gets the DbConnection object associated with the transaction.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OATransaction.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Gets the isolation level of this OATransaction.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.Data.Common.OATransaction.Connection
member.summary: Gets OAConnection for this EntityTransaction.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Diagnostics.DatabaseMetricsTransformation`1.Calculate(System.String,System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Provides a calculation of the metrics and properties into new property values.
member.remarks:
The basic idea is to operate on (one or two) sets of data and stream process them into a new set of data that can be assigned to a target property field later or into a temporary field (#name).
The following operations are currently defined:
Description
= t = source
+ t = a + b
- t = a - b
* t = a * b
DeltaRatio(a,a+b) Calculate deltas for all a and b values so that t[i] = x[i]-x[i-1] with i the index in the time line. Then calculate t = (a * 100) / (a+b)
Ratio(a,a+b) Calculate t = (a * 100) / (a+b)
Ratio(a,b) Calculate t = (a * 100) / b
MetricDelta Calculate t[i] = s[i] - s[i-1] with i the index in the time line
MetricMin Calculate t[i] = min(s[i],s[i-1]) with i the index in the time line
MetricMax Calculate t[i] = max(s[i],s[i-1]) with i the index in the time line
MetricAbs Calculate t[i] = abs(s[i],s[i-1]) with i the index in the time line
member.param: Target property name
Indication of calculation method to use (+,-,*,=,...).
The needed parameters (a, b, source).

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Diagnostics.History.GetDatabaseMetrics(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns the filtered aggregated metric counters for the used database instance.
member.remarks:
The metric counters can be used to obtain runtime behavior statistics in order to aid application monitoring. The aggregated counters returned by are affected by the actions of all context instances using the same database as this instance.
To obtain non-aggregated metric counter values for this context instance, please refer to the method.
In order to use aggregated metric counter value for the database, the metric snapshot feature must have been turned on by specifying the interval of the snapshots and the capacity. This can be achieved with the and properties.
member.param: When given, the start time exclusive filter to use (UTC required)
When given, the inclusive end time filter to use (UTC required)
When given, limits the number of found elements from the start (value greater than 0) or from the end (value smaller than 0).
member.returns: New metric instance that holds the multiple aggregated counter values or null when no metrics are found

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.Diagnostics.History.GetDatabaseEvents(System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.DateTime},System.Nullable{System.Int32})
member.summary: Returns the filtered aggregated events for the used database instance.
member.remarks: The event collections can be used to observe the runtime behavior wrt. internal pooling activity, SQL execution, configuration etc.
member.param: When given, the start time exclusive filter to use (UTC required)
When given, the inclusive end time filter to use (UTC required)
When given, limits the number of found elements from the start (value greater than 0) or from the end (value smaller than 0).
member.returns: New instance that holds the multiple aggregated events or null when no events are found

member.summary: Returns the filtered aggregated events for the used database instance.
member.remarks: The event collections can be used to observe the runtime behavior wrt. internal pooling activity, SQL execution, configuration etc.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Diagnostics.DatabaseMetricsCollection
member.summary: Container for a collection of aggregated database metric values.
member.remarks:
Telerik Data Access provides a number of performance related metrics, that can be obtained through the method to observe the runtime behavior of an application.
The metrics are ordered by their timestamp value (DateTime UTC format) and provide a number of values. The names (implying their meaning) of the values can be obtained from the properties, and the time line for a given name can be retrieved with the method.
Functionality to store or load metric data is available from the and methods.
The timespan between two metric snapshots can be obtained from the property in milliseconds.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents
member.summary: Provides change tracking events for modifications of persistent objects.
member.remarks:
This interface provides events which can be used to get track changes on persistent objects. Such events can be used to implement custom change tracking models.
An instance of this interface is always bound to one instance. It can be obtained from the property.

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Changing
member.summary: Occurs before a field of a persistent object is changed by the application.
member.remarks:
The Changing event is raised before the new value of a field is assigned to the field.
It is possible to avoid the assignment by throwing an exception.
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Changed
member.summary: Occurs after a field of a persistent object has been changed by the application.
member.remarks: The Changed event is raised after the new value of a field has been assigned to the field.
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Adding
member.summary: Occurs before a persistent object is added to the object context.
member.remarks:
The Adding event is raised before the object is added to an instance.
It is possible to avoid the persisting of an object by throwing an exception.
Please note, that the retrieval of the (possibly database-assigned) object identity is not possible before the object is actually known to the object context. When this object identity retrieval is required, the event should be used.
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Added
member.summary: Occurs after an object was marked as to be persisted by the object context.
member.remarks: The Added event is raised after the persistent object has been added to the .
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Removing
member.summary: Occurs before a persistent object is removed from the object context.
member.remarks:
The Removing event is raised before the object is removed the instance.
It is possible to avoid the deletion of a persistent object by throwing an exception.
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Removed
member.summary: Occurs after a persistent object was marked as to be removed from the object context.
member.remarks:
The Removed event is raised after the persistent object has been removed from the .
Please note, that an access of the field values of a removed persistent object is not possible. When this access is required, the event should be used.
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Refreshing
member.summary: Occurs before a persistent object is refreshed from the database.
member.remarks:
The Refreshing is raised occurs before the object is reloaded from the database.
It is possible to avoid the refreshing of a persistent object by throwing an exception.
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.Refreshed
member.summary: Occurs after a persistent object was refreshed from the database.
member.remarks: The Refreshed event is raised after the persistent object has been refreshed from the database.
member.example: Please refer to the example of .

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.IContextEvents.ObjectConstructed
member.summary: Occurs after an object has been constructed by Telerik Data Access runtime.
member.remarks: The events is fired after Telerik Data Access has materialized an entity instance. This can happen if an object has been loaded using GetObjectByKey() method, as results of a LINQ query or after a navigation property is loaded (either lazily or eagerly).

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelOneCache
member.summary: The level one cache is the cache directly bound to the context.
member.remarks:
The context caches all new, dirty and deleted objects since the last SaveChanges or ClearChanges call.
All clean data is only held by a special structure to ensure the uniqueness of all entities in one context. The type of references from this structure can be controlled by the .

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelOneCache.Release(System.Object)
member.summary: Marks the entity as not longer needed in this context.
member.remarks: If it is possible to get rid of the data inside the entity, it is released. If no references to the entity exists, the garbage collector can collect it. If the entity is new, deleted or changed, this call does nothing.
member.param: The entity to be marked as not longer needed.
member.exception: 'entity' cannot be null.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelOneCache.ReleaseAll
member.summary: Marks all entities managed by the context as not longer needed.
member.remarks: If it is possible to get rid of the data inside the entity, it is released. If no references to the entity exists, the garbage collector can collect it. If the entity is new, deleted or changed, this call does not change that.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelOneCache.ReleaseAll(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.Object})
member.summary: Marks the entities as not longer needed in this context.
member.remarks: If it is possible to get rid of the data inside the entities, it is released. If no references to the entities exist, the garbage collector can collect them. If an entity is new, deleted or changed, this call does nothing.
member.param: The entities to be marked as not longer needed.
member.exception: 'entities' cannot be null.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache
member.summary: Level two cache management.
member.remarks:
The level two cache managing instance can be reached from the instance. All functions can be used to control the content of the second level cache. If objects need to be evicted from the cache several functions are available.
The level two cache has to be enabled on the . The property has to be set to 'true'. To enable the query cache property must be set to 'true'.
The level two cache is shared by all context instances. I several processes accesses the same database, the caches must be synchronized. This can be done by setting up a cache cluster .

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.Evict(Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectKey)
member.summary: Evict all information for an ObjectKey instance from the second level cache.
member.param: ObjectKey of the persistent instance to be evicted
member.exception: ObjectKey must not be null.
ObjectKey should be valid.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.EvictAll
member.summary: Evicts all entities from the second level cache.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.EvictAll(System.Type)
member.summary: Evicts all information for all persistent instances of a certain type from the second level cache.
member.param: Type of persistent instances to be evicted.
member.exception: Type has to be the type of a persistent entity.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.EvictAll(System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Evicts all information for all persistent instances of a certain type from the second level cache.
member.param: Type of persistent instances to be evicted.
If true then instances of derived types are also evicted
member.exception: Type has to be the type of a persistent entity.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.EvictAll(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectKey})
member.summary: Evicts all information for a collection of ObjectKey instances from the second level cache.
member.param: Collection of ObjectKey of the persistent instances to be evicted.
member.exception: EntityKeyList should not be null.
All ObjectKeys should be valid.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.EvictAll``1
member.summary: Evicts all information for all persistent instances of a certain type from the second level cache.
member.typeparam: Type of persistent instances to be evicted.
member.exception: T has to be the type of a persistent entity.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.EvictAll``1(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Evicts all information for all persistent instances of a certain type from the second level cache.
member.typeparam: Type of persistent instances to be evicted
member.param: If true then instances of derived types are also evicted.
member.exception: T has to be the type of a persistent entity.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.ILevelTwoCache.IsCached(Telerik.OpenAccess.ObjectKey)
member.summary: Indicates if object is cached.
member.param: ObjectKey instance of the entity that should be checked.
member.exception: ObjectKey should not be null.
ObjectKey should be valid.
member.returns: True if object is cached, false if not.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.LoggingLevel

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.LoggingLevel.Errors
member.summary: Logs only errors (such as connections timing out)

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.LoggingLevel.None
member.summary: Logs no events. Use this only while doing benchmarking.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.LoggingLevel.Normal
member.summary: Logs the most of the events that do not reduce performance significantly (e.g. SQL executed)

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.LoggingLevel.Verbose
member.summary: Logs majority of the events (this slows down the performance, recommended only for debugging purposes)

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.LoggingLevel.All
member.summary: Logs all possible events (this slows down the performance significantly, could be used while debugging)

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType
member.summary: Telerik Data Access abstraction for the native sql types
member.remarks: Each supported database has its own type system. This makes it necessary to have different mappings for different databases (MS SQL Server has a nvarchar(max), oracle has a varchar2). The OpenAccessType is an abstraction above all backend types. It is possible to specify one OpenaccessType for all backends and the backends can then map to their respective types. As long as only OpenAccessTypes are used in the mapping, the mapping is database independent and can be used with all backends.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Undefined
member.summary: Mapping not specified

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Boolean
member.summary: A simple type representing Boolean values of true or false.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Bit
member.summary: A simple type representing bit values of 0 or 1

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Byte
member.summary: An 8-bit integer ranging in value from -128 to 127.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Int16
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 16-bit integers with values between -32768 and 32767.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Int32
member.summary: An integral type representing signed 32-bit integers with values between -2147483648 and 2147483647.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.OpenAccessType.Int64

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType
member.summary: Defines the type of associations available in the Telerik Data Access meta model.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.Reference
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a reference property.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.PolymorphicReference
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a reference to a class hierarchy or interface.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.Collection
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a collection property.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.OneToOne
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: both sides are implemented as reference properties.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.OneToMany
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: one is reference property and the other is the corresponding collection (calculated).

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.OneToManyJointable
member.summary: Specifies a unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends) and the 'end role ' is implemented using a join table.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.ManyToManyJointable
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: both sides are implemented as collection properties. The association is implemented using a join table.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.DictionaryJointable
member.summary: Specifies a binary association that has both ends of the association set: one is the dictionary and the other can be a reference or a key value property to another dictionary.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.Metadata.AssociationType.StructReference
member.summary: Specifies an unary association (that has a 'role' only on one of the ends), and the 'end role' is implemented as a structure (value object) property. NOT SUPPORTED currently.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration
member.summary: Provides the backend configuration settings affecting the runtime behavior of Telerik Data Access
member.remarks: The settings that can be made on the backend configuration properties will configure the not yet opened database in its default values. It will not affect the database in its configuration once the database is opened.

member.summary: Merges the backend configuration entries defined in the application configuration file to a BackendConfiguration object defined imperatively in code.
member.param: The compiled object where the settings read from configuration file will be merged to.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.MergeBackendConfigurationFromConfigFile(Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration,Telerik.OpenAccess.ConfigurationMergeMode)
member.summary: Merges the backend configuration entries defined in the application configuration file to a BackendConfiguration object defined imperatively in code.
member.param: The compiled object where the settings read from configuration file will be merged to.
The merge mode used in case configuration properties are explicitly specified in configuration file and in code.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.MergeBackendConfigurationFromConfigFile(Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration,Telerik.OpenAccess.ConfigurationMergeMode,System.String)
member.summary: Merges the backend configuration entries defined in the application configuration file to a BackendConfiguration object defined imperatively in code.
member.param: The compiled object where the settings read from configuration file will be merged to.
The merge mode used in case configuration properties are explicitly specified in configuration file and in code.
The name of the backendConfiguration entry specified in the configuration file.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Controls the timeout of database client/server connections after the last ObjectScope disposal.

remarks.para: Database client/server connections are closed ConnectionTimeout milliseconds after the last object scope associated with the connection is disposed. If a new object scope is obtained in the meantime, the connection is not closed.
By default, the timeout is -1, i.e. connections are never closed.
It is mostly useful in application server scenarios, where closing the last ObjectScope might not immediately mean, that the database server connections are to be closed too.

member.value: The timeout value is given in milliseconds.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.Driver
member.summary: Controls the name of the driver to be used.
member.remarks: Only in cases where the NTDS or ODP drivers are to be used you need to specify this here.
member.value: genericADO2, odp, ntds (Default: genericADO2)

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.Backend
member.summary: The name of the backend to be used.
member.value: String representation of a enumeration value.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ProviderName
member.summary: The invariant name of the database driver to be used.
member.value: Invariant driver name as present in the app.config or machine.config file.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.Assemblies
member.summary: Gets the list of assemblies that should be searched for persistent types.
member.remarks: You need to add your assemblies here in order to get the enhanced persistent types defined in them into the mapping configuration.
member.value: Modifiable list of assemblies

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.Logging

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration
member.summary: Configures the runtime settings of the HighLow key generator.
member.remarks: The HighLow key generator can further be configured with the MetadataContainer (table name, column names, ...).

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.GrabSize
member.summary: Controls the (minimal) number of new keys fetched in one server call.
member.value: Default: 10

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.Start
member.summary: Controls the starting value as given out by the generator.
member.remarks: When a new highlow key generator table is generated, this setting controls the initial starting value that used by Telerik Data Access.
member.value: Default: 0

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.IgnoreMissingTables
member.summary: Controls the check during database open operation.
member.remarks: If a table does not exists in the database the corresponding row in the keygen table is not inserted. This leads to an exception if such an object should be stored later.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.KeyColumnName
member.summary: Controls the name of the column storing the table name in the highlow key generator.
member.remarks: When a new highlow key generator table is generated, this setting controls the name of the primary key column that stores the table name.
member.value: Default: table_name

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.KeyColumnOpenAccessType
member.summary: Controls the sql type of the column storing the table name in the highlow key generator.
member.remarks: When a new highlow key generator table is generated, this setting controls the sql type of the primary key column that stores the table name.
member.value: Default: 12 == VARCHAR

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.KeyColumnLength
member.summary: Controls the length of the column storing the table name in the highlow key generator.
member.remarks: When a new highlow key generator table is generated, this setting controls the length of the primary key column that stores the table name.
member.value: Default: 64

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.ValueColumnName
member.summary: Controls the name of the column storing the most recent pk value in the highlow key generator.
member.remarks: When a new highlow key generator table is generated, this setting controls the name of the column that stores the most recent primary key value.
member.value: Default: table_name

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.TableName
member.summary: Controls the table name used by the highlow key generator.
member.remarks: When a new highlow key generator table is generated, this setting controls the name of the table.
member.value: Default: voa_keygen

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.HighLowKeyGeneratorConfiguration.CreateTable
member.summary: Controls whether the table used by the HighLow key generator is generated automatically.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration
member.summary: Configures the database connections and the connection pool
member.remarks: This instance controls how connections to the database server are configured and how they are pooled.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.Pool
member.summary: Controls which ConnectionPool behavior should be used. The behavior of the ADO driver or the behavior of Telerik Data Access.
member.value: Default: ConnectionPoolType.Integrated

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.ActiveConnectionTimeout
member.summary: Controls the time out in seconds for active connections; controls how long query results on the server are held open.
member.value: Default: 120

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.BlockWhenFull
member.summary: Controls the behavior of the empty connection pool when a new connection is requested.
member.value: Default: true (blocking)

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.Reserved
member.summary: Controls the number of pooled reserved connections (e.g. used by the HighLow key generator).
member.remarks: The number of connections in the pool that are used for key generator purposes is controlled with this value.
member.value: Default: 1

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.MaxActive
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of active connections in the connection pool.
member.remarks: This value also sets the connection pool maximum size.
member.value: Default: 10

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.IsolationLevel
member.summary: Controls the isolation level that should be used on the database server.
member.remarks: Not all isolation levels are available with all database backends.
member.value: One of: ReadCommitted, ReadUncommitted, RepeatableRead, Serializable, Snapshot, Chaos, Unspecified; Default: ReadCommitted

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.InitSQL
member.summary: Gets a list of SQL statements that will be executed after creation of a connection before it is put into the connection pool.
member.remarks: You can append SQL statements to the InitSQL list in order to perform a customization of your connections.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.DatabaseNameMapping
member.summary: Gets a map of logical database name to physical database name.
member.remarks: The map that is returned by this property is used to alter logical database names to physical database names. This can be useful with f.e. MSSQL.
member.value: Map that maps logical name to physical name

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.Integrated
member.summary: Get the Integrated ConnectionPool settings for Telerik Data Access. This is only useful when using Pool=Integrated

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.TestInterval
member.summary: Controls the time in seconds between subsequent tests whether an idle connection is still valid.
member.remarks: This setting applies only to connections held by the connection pool that are idle.
member.value: Default: 120

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.MaxIdle
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of idle connections in the connection pool.
member.remarks: When a connection becomes idle (unused) and is about to be returned to the connection pool, the decision whether to close the connection or to pool it is based on this setting.
member.value: Default: 10

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.MinIdle
member.summary: Controls the minimum number of idle connections in the connection pool.
member.value: Default: 2

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.TestOnAlloc
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested for operation when they are unpooled
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.TestOnRelease
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested for operation when they are pooled
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.TestOnException
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested for operation after an exception occurred
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.TestWhenIdle
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested when they are idle
member.value: Default: 1

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.MaxConnectionAge
member.summary: Controls the maximum number a connection can be returned to the connection pool before it is closed to free accumulated resources.
member.value: Default: 1000

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.PreparedStatementCacheEnabled
member.summary: Controls if the prepared statement pool cache is enabled.
member.remarks: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.PreparedStatementCacheMax
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of prepared statements to be cached on a connection
member.value: Default: 0, unlimited

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.ValidateSQL
member.summary: Controls the SQL that is used to test connections for operation
member.value: Default: null, automatically generated based on the backend

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.ConnectRetryCount
member.summary: Controls the number of connect retries that are attempted until a connection can be established
member.remarks: This value applies only to the non-first connection made to the database.
member.value: Default: 30

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.ConnectionPoolConfiguration.ConnectRetryIntervalMSec
member.summary: Controls the time between connect retry attempts in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This value applies only to the non-first connection made to the database.
member.value: Default: 1

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration
member.summary: Configures settings for the Internal connection management provided by Telerik Data Access.
member.remarks: This instance controls how connections to the database server are configured and how they are pooled.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.TestInterval
member.summary: Controls the time in seconds between subsequent tests whether an idle connection is still valid.
member.remarks: This setting applies only to connections held by the connection pool that are idle.
member.value: Default: 120

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.MaxIdle
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of idle connections in the connection pool.
member.remarks: When a connection becomes idle (unused) and is about to be returned to the connection pool, the decision whether to close the connection or to pool it is based on this setting.
member.value: Default: 10

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.MinIdle
member.summary: Controls the minimum number of idle connections in the connection pool.
member.value: Default: 2

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.TestOnAlloc
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested for operation when they are unpooled
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.TestOnRelease
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested for operation when they are pooled
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.TestOnException
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested for operation after an exception occurred
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.TestWhenIdle
member.summary: Controls if connections are tested when they are idle
member.value: Default: 1

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.MaxConnectionAge
member.summary: Controls the maximum number a connection can be returned to the connection pool before it is closed to free accumulated resources.
member.value: Default: 1000

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.ConnectRetryCount
member.summary: Controls the number of connect retries that are attempted until a connection can be established
member.remarks: This value applies only to the non-first connection made to the database.
member.value: Default: 30

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.ConnectRetryIntervalMSec
member.summary: Controls the time between connect retry attempts in milliseconds.
member.remarks: This value applies only to the non-first connection made to the database.
member.value: Default: 1000

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.PreparedStatementCacheEnabled
member.summary: Controls if the prepared statement pool cache is enabled.
member.remarks: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.IntegratedConfiguration.PreparedStatementCacheMax
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of prepared statements to be cached on a connection

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration
member.summary: Configures the runtime

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.MediumTrust
member.summary: Controls if medium-trust environments are supported.
member.remarks: Under medium trust, some operations cannot be performed and the Telerik Data Access runtime must be made aware of this. This affects things where privileged operations are needed.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.WriteArtificialTypesToDisk
member.summary: Controls if assemblies containing artificial types are written to disk.
member.remarks: Artificial types can be generated at runtime. To aid debugging, the assemblies in which those types are contained can be written to disk. Artificial types assemblies are never loaded from disk, however.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.SupportConcurrentThreadsInScope
member.summary: Controls if the runtime supports concurrent threads within one objects scope.
member.remarks: Enabling the support for concurrent threads will turn on additional synchronization which can affect performance.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CheckSchemaConsistencyOnStartup
member.summary: Controls if the class/table mapping is validated on startup of the application.
member.remarks: Enabling the startup check will require some time when the database is opened.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CheckObjectConsistencyOnCommit
member.summary: Controls whether the consistency of the object graph in the local cache is ensured. If set to 'true', this makes sure that all birectional relationships (one-many and many-many) are in sync.
member.remarks: This setting is useful when using managed collections. Since this a time consuming operation it should be used for debugging purposes only.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ReadOnly
member.summary: Controls if write operations against the database are permitted.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.LockTimeoutMSec
member.summary: Controls the lock time out in milliseconds.
member.remarks: The value that is given with this property is passed to the database server.
member.value: Default: 5000

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.LockSqlSuffix
member.summary: Gets or sets the SQL that is appended to a 'SELECT FOR UPDATE' statement which is used to obtain a write lock when using pessimistic concurrency control.
member.remarks: The specified value is passed to the database server when locking requests are made.
member.value: Default: FOR UPDATE. This value is backend specific

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CloseScopesWithActiveTransaction
member.summary: Controls if closing of an object scope with an active transaction is allowed.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CloseDatabaseWithActiveTransactions
member.summary: Controls if closing a database with active transactions is allowed.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.PerformanceCounter
member.summary: Gets or sets whether performance counters for the Second level cache and Second level cache cluster are enabled.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.PerformanceCounterName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the performance counter instance.
member.value: Default: "{ConnectionId}-{ProcessId}"

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ParallelFetchingEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether parallel fetching of a sub collection is enabled.
member.remarks: Parallel fetching allows the use of multiple result sets, if the backend supports it, in a combined way for an improved performance
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.StatementBatchingEnabled
member.summary: Controls statement batching for modifying operations.
member.remarks:
Some database backends (MSSQL,Oracle,Postgres) provide support for batching DML operations (INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE) to reduce the number of network accesses. When StatementBatchingEnabled is True, the DML operations will be done in batches if multiple rows on the same table are involved.
This property controls if the statement batching should occur for those database systems that support it.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.StatementBatchingThreshold
member.summary: Controls the threshold for using statement batching of modifying operations.
member.remarks:
This property controls the threshold that enables the statement batching. If in a transaction N similar modification operations need to be performed and N is bigger than the value of this property, statement batching can occur.
If you find the overhead of actual batching operations to big, increase the value of this property.
member.value: Default: 1 (Two or more similar rows could be handled in a batched operation.)

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.StatementBatchingSize
member.summary: Controls the maximum amount of batched modification operations.
member.remarks:
This property controls the amount of operations batched together on the ADO driver level. If statement batching occurs, the resulting network packets can get large (depending on the data used), and this setting can then be used to reduce the size of the packets at the expense of creating more packets overall.
The value is passed into the property.
member.value: Default: 100 (100 rows will be handled together by the ADO driver.)

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ReadWithoutTransactions
member.summary: Controls if normal query operations are done without database transactions.
member.value: Default: true
member.remarks:
This property controls whether simple queries can be performed outside of database transactions. Queries issued for locking purposes or user given SQL queries will create transactions regardless of this setting. When the property is accessed, a transaction will be started too. LINQ and OQL queries and lazy loading will obey this setting.
Changing this setting to false can have a negative effect on performance, as more client/server calls are involved.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.InterceptDefaultFetchGroupFieldAccess
member.summary: Gets or sets if the optimized code path is used for fields in the default fetch group
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.AllowReadAfterDispose
member.summary: Controls if read operations on the already fetched instances are allowed after managing context disposal.
member.remarks: This property controls if read access on existing persistent objects is allowed after the managing context has been disposed.
member.value: True for allowing read access after the managing context has been disposed.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.AllowReadAfterDelete
member.summary: Controls if read operations on the already deleted instances are allowed.
member.remarks: This property controls if read access on existing persistent objects is allowed after it has been deleted.
member.value: True for allowing read access after the object has been deleted.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.Hyperdrive
member.summary: For internal use only
member.remarks: This property controls the HypderDrive feature.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ClassBehavior
member.summary: Controls the default modification behavior of persistent types.
member.value: One of: readwrite, readonly, insertonly; Default: readwrite

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CacheReferenceType
member.summary: Controls the type of reference that is used in the cache of the object scope.
member.remarks: When objects and states (prefetched data) are held strongly, it is normally necessary to dispose the object scope as otherwise the referenced memory cannot be garbage collected.
member.value: Default: AUTO

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.DatabaseTransactionLocking
member.summary: Controls which objects are locked when pessimistic concurrency control is used.
member.value: One of: FIRST, NONE, ALL; Default: FIRST

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ReturnNullForRowNotFound
member.summary: Controls if null is to be returned when an object is not found.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.RequirePersistentClasses
member.summary: Controls if the opening of a database requires persistent classes to be present.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.Optimistic
member.summary: Controls if optimistic transactions are used or pessimistic locking is to be performed.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.Concurrency
member.summary: Specifies which concurrency control is used
member.remarks: Optimistic and pessimistic modes can be chosen. The pessimistic implicit mode can be fine tuned by setting to "FIRST" or "ALL" additionally.
member.value: The to specify the concurrency control.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.RetainConnectionInOptimisticTransaction
member.summary: Controls if the connection is to be retained in optimistic transactions.
member.remarks: The default is to return the connection back into the connection pool.
member.value: One of: null, true, false; Default: null

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ScopeImplementationPoolEnabled
member.summary: Controls if the implementation objects underlying the object scope can be pooled.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.ScopeImplementationPoolMaxIdle
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of idle scope implementation objects.
member.value: Default: 8

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CompiledQueryCacheSize
member.summary: Controls the maximum number of queries that are kept in the precompiled query cache.
member.remarks: The precompiled query cache is the one that holds already computed translations from OQL / LINQ to the corresponding SQL expressions.
member.value: Default: 1000, unlimited

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.UseUTCForAutoSetValues
member.summary: Controls if the datetime values that are automatically set during commit will use UTC.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.UseUTCForReadValues
member.summary: Controls if the datetime values that are read will be converted to use UTC.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.NullsFirst
member.summary: Controls if the database will use NULLS FIRST sorting.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.LikeWithEscape
member.summary: Controls if the database will use the LIKE operator with the ESCAPE character set to backslash.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.HasTempTables
member.summary: Controls is the database will attempt to use temporary tables.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.OnlyMetadata
member.summary: Controls if the OpenAccessContext will be created to obtain only the Metadata and not actually connect to the database.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.MetricCapacity
member.summary: Controls the number of metric snapshots that will be held internally.
member.remarks:
A value of 60*60 = 3600 would allow to buffer metric snapshots for one hour when the is set to 1000 milliseconds.
The metric snapshots will be held in a ring buffer.
member.value: Default: 0

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.MetricInterval
member.summary: Controls the time span between two metric snapshots in milliseconds
member.remarks:
A value less than 100 is not settable and will default to 1000 (=1 second).
The overall duration for which metric snapshots are held in the internal ring buffer can be calculated by * (in milliseconds). Example: MetricInterval=1000ms * MetricCapacity=3600 would allow to store the metric snapshots of the last 1 hour
member.value: Default: 1000

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.AllowNonNullableColumnsInVerticalInheritance
member.summary: Allows the generation of non nullable columns in vertically inherited classes.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.DefaultStreamBufferSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the default buffer size for Stream fields.

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.PrepareCommands
member.summary: Controls the creation of prepared commands used to perform CRUD operations.
member.value: Default: true

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.AllowCascadeDelete
member.summary: Controls the default behavior for deletion when nothing is specified on the class level in the MetadataContainer.
member.remarks:
Cascading deletes can speed up the deletion process as dependent table rows are automatically deleted be the database server, eliminating costly C/S calls.
Cascading delete behavior is currently available for all vertical tables and multi-table entities.
If nothing is specified for a given persistent type, this value controls if cascading delete is performed. That means, you can explicitly turn it on/off for a given class (via ) or you can control the behavior by setting this AllowCascadeDelete property.
member.value: Default: false

member.name: P:Telerik.OpenAccess.BackendConfiguration.RuntimeConfiguration.CommandTimeout
member.summary: Controls the global CommainTimeout value in seconds that is set to all DbCommands used in Telerik Data Access.

remarks.para: Different database servers can interpret the provided value differently. For example SQL Compact Edition currently does no support non zero timeouts.
Other BackendConfiguration settings can also affect the behavior of commands and their timeout. See and .

member.value: Default: 30 (seconds)

member.remarks: Join tables are generated for mapped collections. If only one side of the m:n is visible in the model, per default only the index on the collection side is generated.
