member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields
member.summary:
A class that can be managed by a JDO implementation must implement this interface.
Every class whose instances can be managed by a JDO PersistenceManager must implement the PersistenceCapable interface.
This interface defines methods that allow the implementation to manage the instances. It also defines methods that allow a JDO aware application to examine the runtime state of instances. For example, an application can discover whether the instance is persistent, transactional, dirty, new, or deleted; and to get its associated PersistenceManager if it has one.
In the Reference Implementation, the JDO Enhancer modifies the class to implement PersistenceCapable prior to loading the class into the runtime environment. The Reference Enhancer also adds code to implement the methods defined by PersistenceCapable.
The extra methods in the PersistenceCapable interface might be generated by pre-processing a .java file, or might be generated from a tool directly. The exact technique for generating the extra methods is not specified by JDO.
The PersistenceCapable interface is designed to avoid name conflicts in the scope of user-defined classes. All of its declared method names are prefixed with 'jdo'.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.READ_WRITE_OK
member.summary: If jdoFlags is set to READ_WRITE_OK, then the fields in the default fetch group can be accessed for read or write without notifying the StateManager.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.LOAD_REQUIRED
member.summary: If jdoFlags is set to LOAD_REQUIRED, then the fields in the default fetch group cannot be accessed for read or write without notifying the StateManager.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.DETACHED
member.summary: If jdoFlags is set to DETACHED, then fields identified as loadedFields can be read and written without having a StateManager. Fields modified while detached are kept track of as modifiedFields.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.READ_OK
member.summary: If jdoFlags is set to READ_OK, then the fields in the default fetch group can be accessed for read without notifying the StateManager.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.CHECK_READ
member.summary: If jdoFieldFlags for a field includes CHECK_READ, then the field has been enhanced to call the jdoStateManager on read if the jdoFlags setting is not READ_OK or READ_WRITE_OK.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.MEDIATE_READ
member.summary: If jdoFieldFlags for a field includes MEDIATE_READ, then the field has been enhanced to always call the jdoStateManager on all reads.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.CHECK_WRITE
member.summary: If jdoFieldFlags for a field includes CHECK_WRITE, then the field has been enhanced to call the jdoStateManager on write if the jdoFlags setting is not READ_WRITE_OK;.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.MEDIATE_WRITE
member.summary: If jdoFieldFlags for a field includes MEDIATE_WRITE, then the field has been enhanced to always call the jdoStateManager on all writes.

member.name: F:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable_Fields.SERIALIZABLE
member.summary: If jdoFieldFlags for a field includes SERIALIZABLE, then the field is not declared as TRANSIENT.

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable
member.summary: hidden

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedGetPersistenceManager
member.summary:
Return the associated PersistenceManager if there is one. Transactional and persistent instances return the associated PersistenceManager.
Transient non-transactional instances return null.
This method always delegates to the StateManager if it is non-null.
member.returns: the PersistenceManager associated with this instance.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedReplaceStateManager(Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.StateManager)
member.summary:
This method sets the StateManager instance that manages the state of this instance. This method is normally used by the StateManager during the process of making an instance persistent, transient, or transactional.
The caller of this method must have JDOPermission for the instance, if the instance is not already owned by a StateManager. If the parameter is null, and the StateManager approves the change, then the jdoFlags field will be reset to READ_WRITE_OK. If the parameter is not null, and the security manager approves the change, then the jdoFlags field will be reset to LOAD_REQUIRED.
member.param: The StateManager which will own this instance, or null to reset the instance to transient state
member.throws: SecurityException if the caller does not have JDOPermission

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedProvideField(System.Int32)
member.summary: The owning StateManager uses this method to ask the instance to provide the value of the single field identified by fieldNumber.
member.param: the field whose value is to be provided by a callback to the StateManager's providedXXXField method

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedProvideFields(System.Int32[])
member.summary: The owning StateManager uses this method to ask the instance to provide the values of the multiple fields identified by fieldNumbers.
member.param: the fields whose values are to be provided by multiple callbacks to the StateManager's providedXXXField method

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedReplaceField(System.Int32)
member.summary: The owning StateManager uses this method to ask the instance to replace the value of the single field identified by number.
member.param: the field whose value is to be replaced by a callback to the StateManager's replacingXXXField method

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedReplaceFields(System.Int32[])
member.summary: The owning StateManager uses this method to ask the instance to replace the values of the multiple fields identified by number.
member.param: the fields whose values are to be replaced by multiple callbacks to the StateManager's replacingXXXField method

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedReplaceFlags
member.summary: The owning StateManager uses this method to ask the instance to replace the value of the flags by calling back the StateManager ReplacingFlags method.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedMakeDirty(System.String)
member.summary:
Explicitly mark this instance and this field dirty. Normally, PersistenceCapable classes are able to detect changes made to their fields. However, if a reference to an array is given to a method outside the class, and the array is modified, then the persistent instance is not aware of the change. This API allows the application to notify the instance that a change was made to a field.
The field name should be the fully qualified name, including package name and class name of the class declaring the field. This allows unambiguous identification of the field to be marked dirty. If multiple classes declare the same field, and if the package and class name are not provided by the parameter in this API, then the field marked dirty is the field declared by the most derived class.
Transient instances ignore this method.
member.param: the name of the field to be marked dirty.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedPreSerialize
member.summary: Ensure that object is loaded. fieldNo is currently ignored

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedGetObjectId
member.summary:
Return a copy of the JDO identity associated with this instance.
Persistent instances of PersistenceCapable classes have a JDO identity managed by the PersistenceManager. This method returns a copy of the ObjectId that represents the JDO identity.
Transient instances return null.
The ObjectId may be serialized and later restored, and used with a PersistenceManager from the same JDO implementation to locate a persistent instance with the same data store identity.
If the JDO identity is managed by the application, then the ObjectId may be used with a PersistenceManager from any JDO implementation that supports the PersistenceCapable class.
If the JDO identity is not managed by the application or the data store, then the ObjectId returned is only valid within the current transaction.
If the JDO identity is being changed in the transaction, this method returns the object id as of the beginning of the current transaction.
member.returns: a copy of the ObjectId of this instance as of the beginning of the transaction.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedIsDirty(System.String)
member.summary:
Tests whether this object is dirty.
Instances that have been modified, deleted, or newly made persistent in the current transaction return true.
Transient instances return false.
member.returns: true if this instance has been modified in the current transaction.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedIsTransactional
member.summary:
Tests whether this object is transactional.
Instances whose state is associated with the current transaction return true.
Transient instances return false.
member.returns: true if this instance is transactional.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedIsPersistent
member.summary: Tests whether this object is persistent. Instances that represent persistent objects in the data store return true.
member.returns: true if this instance is persistent.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedIsNew
member.summary:
Tests whether this object has been newly made persistent.
Instances that have been made persistent in the current transaction return true.
Transient instances return false.
member.returns: true if this instance was made persistent in the current transaction.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedIsDeleted
member.summary:
Tests whether this object has been deleted.
Instances that have been deleted in the current transaction return true.
Transient instances return false.
member.returns: true if this instance was deleted in the current transaction.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedNewInstance(Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.StateManager)
member.summary:
Return a new instance of this class, with the jdoStateManager set to the parameter, and jdoFlags set to LOAD_REQUIRED.
This method is used as a performance optimization as an alternative to using reflection to construct a new instance. It is used by the Telerik.OpenAccess.RT.PersistentClassesRegistry class method newInstance.
member.returns: a new instance of this class.
member.param: the StateManager that will own the new instance.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedNewInstance(Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.StateManager,Telerik.OpenAccess.IObjectId)
member.summary:
Return a new instance of this class, with the jdoStateManager set to the parameter, key fields initialized to the values in the oid, and jdoFlags set to LOAD_REQUIRED.
This method is used as a performance optimization as an alternative to using reflection to construct a new instance of a class that uses application identity. It is used by the Telerik.OpenAccess.RT.PersistentClassesRegistry class method newInstance.
member.returns: a new instance of this class.
member.param: the StateManager that will own the new instance.
an instance of the object id class (application identity).

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedNewObjectIdInstance
member.summary: Create a new instance of the ObjectId class for this PersistenceCapable class. The fields will have their Java default values.
member.returns: the new instance created.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.dataobjects.PersistenceCapable.OpenAccessEnhancedNewObjectIdInstance(System.String)
member.summary: Create a new instance of the class used for JDO identity, using the key constructor of the object id class. It is intended only for single field identity. The identity instance returned has no relationship with the values of the primary key fields of the persistence-capable instance on which the method is called. If the key is the wrong class for the object id class, null is returned.
member.returns: the new instance created.
member.param: the String form of the object identity

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.IExtendedObjectScope.GetMetrics(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns the metric counters for this instance and optionally resets the internal values.
member.remarks:
The metric counters can be used to obtain runtime behavior statistics in order to aid application monitoring. The counters returned by are affected by the actions that this object context performs.
To obtain aggregated metric counter values for the used database instance, please refer to the method.
member.param: When True, the internal counter values are reset.
member.returns: New metric instance that holds the context specific values

When keys contain version information or keys contain different persistent types
When value in keys refers to more than one persistent type

member.name: T:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.ProfilerWebServiceImpl
member.summary: Web service implementation to be used by the Telerik Data Access profiler. The class contains the client and server functionality

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.ProfilerWebServiceImpl.GetVersion
member.summary: Returns the version of the web service definition.
member.remarks: The version number will be incremented whenever the service contract changes.
member.returns: A version number to detect if client and server can work together.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.ProfilerWebServiceImpl.GetOpenAccessVersion
member.summary: Returns the OpenAccess version number.
member.returns: OpenAccess version number of the server side used OpenAccess version.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.ProfilerWebServiceImpl.GetDatabaseNames
member.summary: Returns all alias names for all opened databases in the process.
member.returns: Alias names for all opened databases in the process.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.ProfilerWebServiceImpl.GetMetrics(System.String,System.DateTime,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of Telerik Data Access metrics.
member.param: The name of the database instance generating these metrics
Timestamp to restrict the history of metrics.
Maximal amount of data transported.
member.returns: List of Telerik Data Access metrics.

member.name: M:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.ProfilerWebServiceImpl.GetEventsById(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a list of Telerik Data Access log events.
member.param: The name of the database instance generating these metrics
Integer value to restrict the history of the log events.
Maximal amount of data transported.
member.returns: List of Telerik Data Access log events.

member.summary: Returns a list of Telerik Data Access log events.

Timestamp to restrict the history of log events.
Maximal amount of data transported.
member.returns: List of Telerik Data Access log events.

member.name: E:Telerik.OpenAccess.SPI.TrackingImpl.ObjectConstructed
member.summary: Occurs after an object has been constructed by Telerik Data Access runtime.
member.remarks: The events is fired after Telerik Data Access has materialized an entity instance. This can happen if an object has been loaded using GetObjectByKey() method, as results of a LINQ query or after a navigation property is loaded (either lazily or eagerly).
